intro: Gastrolobium praemorsum, commonly known as the Narrow-leaf Hakea, is a shrub native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its narrow, leathery leaves and distinctive flower spikes. The plant produces yellow or orange flowers that are clustered in racemes, attracting nectar-feeding birds and insects. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, with a deep root system for water retention. Gastrolobium praemorsum is often found in sandy soils and is a common component of mallee and coastal vegetation.
